intro: Scaphyglottis densa, commonly known as the dense scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Scaphyglottis densa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and unique foliage.
